resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
tianchen92 commented on pull request #5271: ARROW-6452: [Java] Override ValueVector toString() method
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5271
 
 
   Related to [ARROW-6452](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6452).
   Currently cpp code Array#ToString returns the human readable format string like:
   [
     1,
     2,
     3
   ]
   But Java ValueVector did not implement like this way now.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

jacques-n commented on issue #5271: ARROW-6452: [Java] Override ValueVector toString() method
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5271#issuecomment-527741564
 
 
   Since vectors can be millions of values, we should truncate the message of tostring to something that will fit in a debugger (say 6-8 values)

tianchen92 commented on issue #5271: ARROW-6452: [Java] Override ValueVector toString() method
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5271#issuecomment-527770464
 
 
   > Since vectors can be millions of values, we should truncate the message of tostring to something that will fit in a debugger (say 6-8 values)
   
   You are right, I quickly looked cpp implementation (it's ToString like [window_ values, ..., window_ values]) and updated this PR.

 @@ -690,4 +690,40 @@ public int hashCode(int index) {
     public <OUT, IN> OUT accept(VectorVisitor<OUT, IN> visitor, IN value) {
       return visitor.visit(this, value);

 Review comment:
   It seems the 3 toString methods have much duplicated code, can we merge them into one?

tianchen92 commented on pull request #5271: ARROW-6452: [Java] Override ValueVector toString() method
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5271#discussion_r321554889
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/codegen/templates/UnionVector.java
 ##########
 @@ -690,4 +690,40 @@ public int hashCode(int index) {
     public <OUT, IN> OUT accept(VectorVisitor<OUT, IN> visitor, IN value) {
       return visitor.visit(this, value);
     }
+
+  @Override
 
 Review comment:
   Right, almost same. I thought about this before, the three class only have a common parent interface ValueVector, and we could not have default toString implementation in interface（methods in Object）. The only way to do this seems to put this method in a utility class, is there already exist one or I am not sure is it worth to create a new one?

+

+   * Get the toString() representation of vector suitable for debugging.

 Review comment:
   To make the values in the middle visible, can we make the API more flexible, by providing this API?
   
   public static String getToString(ValueVector vector, int start, int end)
   
   and call it in ValueVector.toString() like this:
   
   ValueVectorUtility.getToString(this, 0, getValueCount());

+
+package org.apache.arrow.vector.util;
+
+import org.apache.arrow.util.Preconditions;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.ValueVector;
+
+/**
+ * Utility methods for {@link ValueVector}.
+ */
+public class ValueVectorUtility {
+
+  /**
+   * Get the toString() representation of vector suitable for debugging.
+   */
+  public static String getToString(ValueVector vector) {
 
 Review comment:
   Thanks for suggestion, I think we could add the API for option, if one want to see middle values, just call this API. But I would prefer call getToString(ValueVector vector) for default for the reason mentioned above (valueCount could be very big) and the behavior is consistent with cpp.
   What do you think?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

+/*
+ * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
+ * contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file distributed with

+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+package org.apache.arrow.vector.util;
+
+import org.apache.arrow.util.Preconditions;
+import org.apache.arrow.vector.ValueVector;
+
+/**
+ * Utility methods for {@link ValueVector}.
+ */
+public class ValueVectorUtility {
+
+  /**
+   * Get the toString() representation of vector suitable for debugging.
+   */
+  public static String getToString(ValueVector vector) {
 
 Review comment:
   > Thanks for suggestion, I think we could add the API for option, if one want to see middle values, just call this API. But I would prefer call getToString(ValueVector vector) for default for the reason mentioned above (valueCount could be very big) and the behavior is consistent with cpp.
   > What do you think?
   
   Sure. I think for getToString(ValueVector vector, int start, int end) method, the middle part should also be represented as "...", so as to avoid OOM.
   The purpose of getToString(ValueVector vector, int start, int end) method is only to allow users to specify the range at will. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Currently cpp code {{Array#ToString}} returns the human readable format string like:

[

  1,

  2,

  3

]

But Java {{ValueVector}} did not implement like this way now.
